meanings.definition: Based on personal accounts rather than facts or research.
meanings.sent1: She made an anecdotally interesting argument during the debate.
meanings.sent2: The book was filled with anecdotally amusing stories.
meanings.sent3: His anecdotally colorful storytelling kept everyone entertained.
meanings.sent4: The movie presented an anecdotally rich portrayal of the historical event.
meanings.sent5: The anecdotally charming characters made the story come alive.

meanings.definition: In a manner that involves sharing anecdotes or personal stories.
meanings.sent1: She spoke anecdotally about her travels around the world.
meanings.sent2: He anecdotally recounted his childhood memories to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The comedian anecdotally joked about his clumsy adventures.
meanings.sent4: The speaker anecdotally weaved humor into her presentation.
meanings.sent5: The teacher anecdotally illustrated the concept with funny stories.
